src:
Pra PON, Ganda Putri Terbaik Bali Dipastikan Tidak Tampil
04 Nov 2019, 12:54 by Ni Putu Nirawati


Pra PON, Ganda Putri Terbaik Bali Dipastikan Tidak Tampil

KBRN, Denpasar: Para atlet silat unggulan Bali sampai saat ini terus di godok untuk mematangkan persiapan menghadapi Pra Kualifikasi Pekan Olahraga Nasional (Pra PON) 12 hingga 17 November di Jakarta.
Sekretaris Umum Ikatan Pencak Silat Indonesia (IPSI) Bali Nyoman Yamadhiputra kepada RRI Senin, (4/11/2019) mengatakan jelang keberangkatan atlet 11 November mendatang, persiapan demi persiapan terus  dilakukan. Tadi pagi jajaran pengurus IPSI Bali bersama Ketua Pelatih juga meminta arahan langsung Wakil Gubenur Bali Cokorda Oka Artha Ardana Sukawati yang notabena selaku mantan Ketua Umum Bakti Negara Bali.
Sementara dari fisik, teknik dan strategi bertanding, para pesilat unggulan Bali jauh-jauh hari sudah menjalani pemusatan latihan di GOR Purnakrida Kerobokan Badung di bawah asuhan tujuh pelatih terbaik di Pulau Dewata.
“Sesuai hasil Porprov kita punya 23 atlet yang akan mewakili Bali, itu hasil Porprov semuanya. Kemudian 1 orang mendapat wild card atas nama Komang Harik Adiputra kelas E Putra yang merupakan juara Asian Games, jadi langsung kita pilih mewakili Bali untuk kelas itu”, ungkapnya.
Pria yang juga Bidang Pembinaan dan Prestasi (Binpres) KONI Bali itu mengatakan untuk kategori Seni nomor Ganda Putri, IPSI Bali sebenarnya juga memberikan wild card untuk pesilat Made Dwiyanti dan Sang Ayu Sidan Wilantari atas prestasi mereka meraih emas di Asian Games, namun sayangnya pada Pra PON kali ini mereka tidak bisa tampil lantaran saat ini Made Dwiyanti masih mengikuti Pra Jabatan Pegawai Negeri Sipil di Kemenpora.
“Termasuk Ganda Putri kita berikan wild card, tetapi yang bersangkutan sedang mengikuti Pra Jabatan di Kemenpora, karena dengan prestasi di Asian Games mereka diangkat menjadi PNS, sehingga bulan ini tidak bisa bertanding. Dari hasil keputusan rapat, jadi kita tunjuk yang juara Porprov langsung mewakili”, jelasnya.
Yamadhiputra mengakui ada sedikit kekhawatiran tersendiri dengan menurunkan pesilat hasil regenerasi Porprov di nomor Ganda Putri. Namun setelah melihat performa atlet yang bersangkutan, IPSI Bali optimis mereka mampu mengantongi tiket PON 2020.
Untuk diketahui pada Pra PON di Jakarta nanti, target IPSI Bali adalah meraih tiket PON pada 19 nomor yang dipertandingkan.
text:
Pre PON, Bali's Best Women's Doubles are Certainly Not Performing
Nov 04 2019, 12:54 p.m. by Ni Putu Nirawati


Pre PON, Bali's Best Women's Doubles are Certainly Not Performing

KBRN, Denpasar: Bali's top martial arts athletes continue to be focused on finalizing preparations for the 12 to 17 November National Sports Week Pre-Qualification in Jakarta.
General Secretary of the Indonesian Pencak Silat Association (IPSI) Bali Nyoman Yamadhiputra told RRI on Monday (11/04/2019) said ahead of the athlete's departure on November 11, preparations for the preparations continued. This morning the ranks of the board of IPSI Bali together with the Chairperson also asked for direct guidance from the Deputy Governor of Bali Cokorda Oka Artha Ardana Sukawati who incidentally as the former Chairperson of the Bali State Service.
Meanwhile, from the physical, technical and competitive strategies, the leading Balinese fighter in the distant days had undergone training camps at GOR Purnakrida Kerobokan Badung under the care of the seven best trainers on the Island of the Gods.
"According to the Porprov results we have 23 athletes who will represent Bali, that's all Porprov results. Then 1 person gets a wild card in the name of Komang Harik Adiputra Putra E class who is an Asian Games champion, so we immediately choose to represent Bali for that class, "he said.
The man who is also the Development and Achievement Division (Binpres) of KONI Bali said that for the Artistry of Women's doubles numbers, IPSI Bali actually also gave wild cards to fighters Made Dwiyanti and Sang Ayu Sidan Wilantari for their achievements in gold at the Asian Games, but unfortunately at Pra PON this time they could not perform because at this time Made Dwiyanti was still following the Pre-Civil Service Position at the Ministry of Youth and Sports.
"Including the Women's doubles we gave a wild card, but those concerned are taking part in the pre-service position at Kemenpora, because with the achievements of the Asian Games they were appointed as civil servants, so this month they cannot compete. From the results of the meeting's decision, we will appoint the Porprov champions to directly represent them, "he explained.
Yamadhiputra acknowledged that there was little concern in reducing Porprov's regeneration fighter in the women's doubles number. But after seeing the performance of the athlete concerned, IPSI Bali is optimistic that they will be able to pocket PON 2020 tickets.
For information on the Pre PON in Jakarta later, the target of IPSI Bali is to get PON tickets on 19 numbers that are contested.
